ai-cnd19:56.3_0: ‘It’s time totally time for the Buddha’s time. It’s the time for the brahmin who well-to-do. It’s the wrong time.’
ai-cnd19:56.4_0: in the last watch of the night,
ai-cnd19:57.1_0: Views of self, views, and identity view are of Sakka who has not committed an offense.
ai-cnd19:57.2_0: Take an uneducated ordinary person who has not seen the noble ones, and is neither skilled nor trained in the teaching of the noble ones. They’ve not seen good persons, and are neither skilled nor trained in the teaching of the good persons.
ai-cnd19:57.6_0: consciousness as self, self as having consciousness, consciousness in self, or self in consciousness.
ai-cnd19:57.7_0: the view of such views, the recipients of views, the recipients of the wrong view, the repulsion, the opposite of the views, the recipients of the path, the fetters, the insistence, the opposite of their views, and the recipientsive views. This is the wrong way to get hold of the wrong view.
ai-cnd19:57.8_0: Having removed (wrong) view of self, attacked it, and lifted it onto the course of the view, he lifted it on after putting it away, having given it up, get rid of it, eliminate it, and obliterated it.
ai-cnd19:58.1_0: When Death comes like this, you might be like that. When your old age might come to death, you should develop the recollection of death, and you should develop mindfulness of death.
ai-cnd19:58.2_0: so death will cross over death.
ai-cnd19:59.1_0: When they do this, realisation, and accumulating thus: “This is the end of the world, its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, thinking,
ai-cnd19:60.1_0: King A person who does not deceive the king of Death; death will not be a King of Death,
ai-cnd19:60.2_0: He doesn’t see (you) thinking: ‘I won’t see a sorry.’ But he doesn’t get rid of responsibility.
ai-cnd19:60.3_0: for this is said by the Buddha,
ai-cnd19:60.4_0: “Mendicants, suppose a forest was staying in the wilderness, in a forest, and in a roar, he walks confidently. He stands confident and poisonous in the forest. And he sits confidently for confidence.
ai-cnd19:60.6_0: He is not, monks, within the range of a hunter.
ai-cnd19:60.7_0: In the same way, a mendicant, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-cnd19:60.8_0: This is called a mendicant who has blinded Māra, put out his eyes without a trace, and gone where the Wicked One cannot see.
ai-cnd19:61.1_0: Furthermore, as the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, a mendicant enters and remains in the second absorption ...
ai-cnd19:61.3_0: he dwells having attained the fourth absorption.
ai-cnd19:61.4_0: This is called a mendicant who has blinded Māra, put out his eyes without a trace, and gone where the Wicked One cannot see.
ai-cnd19:62.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant, going totally beyond perceptions of form, with the ending of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, enters and remains in the dimension of infinite space.
ai-cnd19:62.2_0: This is called a mendicant who has blinded Māra, put out his eyes without a trace, and gone where the Wicked One cannot see.
ai-cnd19:63.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant, going totally beyond the dimension of infinite space, aware that ‘consciousness is infinite’, enters and remains in the dimension of infinite consciousness. ...” ...
ai-cnd19:64.1_0: Furthermore, going totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness, aware that ‘there is nothing at all’, they enter and remain in the dimension of nothingness. ...
ai-cnd19:65.1_0: Furthermore, going totally beyond the dimension of nothingness, they enter and remain in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception. ...
ai-cnd19:66.1_0: Furthermore, take a mendicant who, going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, enters and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling.
ai-cnd19:66.2_0: And, having seen with wisdom, their defilements come to an end.
ai-cnd19:66.3_0: At such a time they are called a mendicant who has blinded Māra, put out his eyes without a trace, and gone where the Wicked One cannot see.
ai-cnd19:66.4_0: he goes, stands confidently, he stands confidently, he stands confidently, he stands confidently.
ai-cnd19:66.6_0: Because they’re out of the Wicked One’s range.”
ai-cnd19:66.7_0: then the King of Death won’t see you.
ai-cnd19:67.4_0: so death will cross over death.
ai-cnd19:67.6_0: king of Death won’t see you.”
ai-cnd19:68.2_0: you’re my teacher, I’m your disciple.
ai-cnd19:68.3_0: Questioning in the Mogharāja, the fifteenth day of the month.
